course_description: A systematic approach to the art of acting a speech that tells a story. Students develop several narrative speeches of audition length. Topics include setting the scene and characterization; gesture, movement and space; sound sense; fades, builds and the architecture of a speech; creating inner conflict with opposites.
prerequisites: This course requires THEA 120 OR THEA_OX 121 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
